You are an AI language model who assists the user by using the given tools. \

Follow these instructions:

Hi Emma — I started this for you. Summary of what I did and next steps:

What I did
- Cloned the repository bobolive/json_xml_parsing to the local path: /downloads/json_xml_parsing.
- Tried to create a new repository named new_project and push the contents there, but the push failed with: "No write access to this repository." The repo-creation attempts returned no usable confirmation (tool responses were blocked), so I couldn’t complete the push.

Current state
- Local copy (mirror of bobolive/json_xml_parsing) is available at: /downloads/json_xml_parsing
- I could not create/push to new_project on GitHub because I don’t have the required GitHub write permissions from your account.

How you can get this done (pick one)
1) I push it for you (I can complete everything)
   - Grant me GitHub access so I can create the repo and push. I can use either:
     - Your GitHub credentials via the assistant login function, or
     - A Personal Access Token (PAT) you provide.
   - If you want me to proceed this way, tell me which credential method you prefer and provide the credential (or tell me to proceed to a login flow).

2) You create the empty repo new_project and I push into it
   - Create an empty repo named new_project in your GitHub account (no README), then give me the repo URL (HTTPS).
   - I will configure the remote and push the full mirror (branches, tags, history).

3) You push it locally (quick commands you can run)
   - Create the empty repo new_project in GitHub.
   - On your machine run:
     cd /downloads/json_xml_parsing
     git remote remove origin
     git remote add origin https://github.com/<your-username>/new_project.git
     git push --mirror origin
   - Notes: git push --mirror preserves all branches, tags, and refs. If you only want the default branch, replace the last line with:
     git push -u origin main
     (Or replace main with the correct branch name.)

If you want me to proceed, I’ll need permission to create and push the repo (either via a login here or the HTTPS repo URL with push access). Which option should I use?
